result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory L. Ferge

records.addlTxt: A victim in this matter has requested to be notified of all proceedings and A victim in this matter has requested to be present at all proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

3:05 PM Defendant Gregory L. Ferge appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Gregory L. Ferge.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.F., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant not to be in a three block radius of victim C.F.'s address.

3:21 PM Defendant Gregory L. Ferge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Gregory L. Ferge.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $10,000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.F., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant not to be in a three block radius of victim C.F.'s address.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
